title: Langton Brackenbury
text:
Henry Langton Brackenbury (26 April 1868 – 28 April 1920) was a British <a href="Conservative%20Party%20%28UK%29">Conservative Party</a> politician who served for two short periods as <a href="Member%20of%20Parliament">Member of Parliament</a> (MP) for <a href="Louth%2C%20Lincolnshire%20%28UK%20Parliament%20constituency%29">Louth</a> in <a href="Lincolnshire">Lincolnshire</a>.
He was first elected at the <a href="January%201910%20United%20Kingdom%20general%20election">general election in January 1910</a>, but was defeated at the <a href="December%201910%20United%20Kingdom%20general%20election">December 1910 general election</a> by the <a href="Liberal%20Party%20%28UK%29">Liberal</a> candidate <a href="Timothy%20Davies%20%28politician%29">Timothy Davies</a>. He regained the seat at the <a href="1918%20United%20Kingdom%20general%20election">1918 general election</a>, but died in office in 1920, aged 52.
The <a href="1920%20Louth%20by-election">by-election after his death</a>, was won by the Liberal candidate <a href="Thomas%20Wintringham%20%28Liberal%20politician%29">Thomas Wintringham</a>.
